name: Lancaster Motor Inn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My nephew has a rustic camp about 20 minutes from this motel - but we do like heat or AC, running water, and TV at night - so we have spent a number of nights in the last few years at the LMI.
reviews.title: No complaints - have returned numerous times

reviews.text: Dogs are allowed, which fits our need - and there is ample grassy area out back for them (remember to pick up after your dogs, as a courtesy to everyone else). It is an older-era motel, in a charming small north-woods NH town, so don't expect a 5-star big city hotel room. What it is clean, friendly, and affordable.
reviews.title: Non-Smoker room is a Farce

reviews.text: Within walking distance there is a Shaw's grocery store, Dunkin Donuts, a drugstore. Also close at hand are other chains (McDs, Subway, etc), and some independent restaurants.
reviews.title: Absolutely Fantastic !!!!!!

reviews.text: So 5-star fancy? Nope. But 5-star small-town, very affordable motel? Sure is.
reviews.title: Wonderful little place

reviews.text: Just a horrible non-smoking room and lobby.Should be thoroughly Sanitized.... look elsewhere.... ignore what I wrote and you will be TOTALLY upset.....I feel that management should of done a better job at getting rid of the lingering tobacco smoke and also fix the heat and WiFi....totally disappointed that WiFi was non-existant In my room.
reviews.title: One of the worst hotels I've stayed in

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were weary from traveling a long distance and my wife didn't feel very well after a difficult week. We were surprised to find this friendly, clean, motor inn as we drove into Lancaster, NH. We weren't expecting such a nice place for such a reasonable rate. We were able to pick up some supper near by at Shaw's and were all set. Thank you for your hospitality! We would recommend this place to anyone!
reviews.title: Great Place to stop

reviews.text: I was there for 7 days i checked into room 124 on the 4/10 the room was very nice and very well appointed.the front desk staff was so helpful in suggesting things to do.and at check in I forget the 2 woman at the desk but they made me feel very welcome. I will be coming back for sure later this summer.
reviews.title: Great motel for the price

reviews.text: The staff is attentive and friendly offering recommendations on places to eat and things to do while in the area. The rooms are clean and the price was right.
reviews.title: A good business stay

reviews.text: I had a wonderful time I was surprised how clean everything was for a motel. It is in a very safe environment. The staff are very friendly and offered places for me and my friends to go to.
reviews.title: Clean and friendly

reviews.text: I recently took my granddaughter for a trip to Santa's Village and booked 3 nights at this place. My first impression of the lobby was that it was old and smelled "funny". The room was no better. It felt and smelled unclean. Even though it was in the non smoking section, it smelled smoky. We had neighbors on one side of us that smoked out in front of their room till about 10 p.m. and started up again the next morning at 6 a.m., even though we were supposedly on the no smoking side. The mattresses were uncomfortable and we were near the road, so every time a truck drove by, it woke us up. The bathroom was ridiculously tiny with the shower so small that it was difficult to lift my arms to wash my hair. The toilet was wedged between the sink and the shower wall. The restaurant was not open, due to a medical emergency and there were only two other places to eat in town. Our first morning there, we were awakened by our noisy neighbors on the other side (hunters~yuch) who started their diesel truck outside our uninsulated window and ran the engine from 5:30 ~6, while trying to hook up their trailer, frequently yelling "Whoa, whoa". I had to argue to get out of the third night's stay. I think the room made my asthma worse. I ended up getting a $43 refund, but had already booked another room at another motel. Even my granddaughter was eager to leave that place.
reviews.title: Not a good stay.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you are visiting the White Mountains and looking for a friendly, clean and very economical motel to stay in, give the Lancaster Motor Inn a try. You will find everything you need and it will leave you enough money to enjoy all the area attractions, such as Santa's Village, Six Gun City, Storyland, Attitash as well as Mt. Washington and all the beautiful mountain scenery, with golf, hiking and fishing and swimming, all nearby. .We have stayed there repeatedly and find the good service and clean rooms to be of a consistent good quality, in this motel.
reviews.title: Lancaster Motor Inn

reviews.text: great location, clean and affordable. took family to Santa's village. nice place for a cheap stay. Fridge and Microwave was a Plus in the room. clean but OK furniture. well come back.
reviews.title: affordable and clean

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I were at Lancaster to attend a music event nearby
reviews.title: 1950's retro

reviews.text: What can I say!! The young lady at the desk (the manager I think) was amazing. Jenny was so friendly, helpful and pleasant. She brightened up our stay by far. She is definitely an asset to this otherwise shabby outdated establishment.
reviews.title: Lancaster Motor Inn, A-1 Place to stay

reviews.text: The exterior of the motel is lovely with a large variety of flowers and hanging baskets. It is really well located next to the courthouse and close to a park and the library as well as the tourist information centre. With such a choice location I cannot imagine why the building has been allowed to become so rundown.
reviews.title: Lovely place, decent staff

reviews.text: I have stayed at the Lancaster Motor Inn a handful of times over the past seven years. The town is small and quiet, and is just what the doctor ordered when it comes to getting away from the city. The Inn is clean, and conveniently located in the center of town. The service was spot on. We had extra towels delivered to our door, and the fridge in our room really helped keep our cold cuts, snacks, and beverages cold. All of the rooms I have stayed in are clean and roomy. I usually travel with two-three friends, and we never had an issue with the space. I have used the Inn in the summer as a motorcycle rest-stop. In the winter I've utilized the Inn as my sledding and skiing rest stop. All-in-all the Lancaster Motor Inn is not the Ritz, but who wants the Ritz in Lancaster NH?!
reviews.title: Clean, convienient, and a great deal all around

reviews.text: Outstanding value. My one complaint is that the tub took awhile to drain. Otherwise, stay here if you're looking for a great deal on a large room, close (ie, walking distance) to amenities.
reviews.title: Great deal on a great, family-friendly hotel

reviews.text: I am a repeat guest, the place looks a lot better and cleaner this year, value is perfect.
reviews.title: clean and affordable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: recomend the restaurant a lot. The lobby looks and feel a lot comfortable with free WiFi internet. the staff is great, loved the flowers. Santa's village is better every year, loved the new water park.
reviews.title: Romantic getaway

reviews.text: We had a lovely time at the Lancaster Motor Inn. The rooms were clean, the bed was comfortable and the staff was attentive. The restaurant was really good too. I used the free wifi for my laptop, which came in handy for my work. We would definitely be back when in the area.
reviews.title: clean and comfortable

description: An exterior corridor Motel, Free parking in front of rooms, Large clean rooms have A queen bed with pull out sofa or two DBL beds. All Rooms have Free Fridge/Microwave/VCR, Free Movies, Free Continental breakfast and Free WIFI internet access. Center of town location. Near by Restaurants and shopping. The Motel is only 5 minutes away from Santa's Village and Six Gun City Attractions. close to many Ski Resorts. Close by public swimming pool. You can snowmobile from your Motel to corridor 5 directly. Minute from Famous Lancaster Fair.
